intro: Bupleurum junceum, commonly known as slender bellflower, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a mild, peppery scent, while its roots are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Bupleurum junceum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats.
